alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WAYNE COUNTY THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 124 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Hagerstown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Centerville, Cambridge City, Hagerstown, Fountain City, Dublin, Franklin, Greens Fork, East Germantown, Spring Grove, Bethel, Economy, Mount Auburn, Whitewater, Middleboro, Jacksonburg, Interstate 70 at Exit 145 and Williamsburg. This includes I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
